basic.description: This course examines the constitution and laws of the European Union (EU).Topics to be considered include: the constitutional structure of the EU, the role of the European Court of Justice, the relationship between EU Law and the domestic laws and courts of members states, EU human rights law, and the law on free movement of goods, workers, and services. Larger issues of theory and policy will also be considered, including the ideas of sovereignty, economic integration, and international cooperation.  Three term-hours; Not offered 2010-2011.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: European Union Law
